lexUnit.name: butt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: hit with the head or horns.

sentence.text: He rushed towards her so violently that Miss Fogerty put out her hands to grasp his shoulders before he should butt her to the ground .
When he told him he would be arrested for being drunk , Sweeney butted him in his left eye and brought his knee up to his groin .
She had tried to pick him up but he had clung to the banister rail like a leech and butted her in the chest with his head .
If he made a joke and she realized it was one , she used to butt him in the chest -- she was much shorter -- and say ` You 're silly ! "
During the construction of the nest , the male is intolerant of his mate and she will be chased away and butted if she becomes too inquisitive .
She butted him in the chest with her head and he slipped in the mud and fell on his back .
Instead all males chased and butted the female .
` Mummy , I want Mummy , " hitting him and butting him in the stomach with her head , like a little goat .
Golden artificial sunlight filled a wainscotted room with a frieze of unicorns butting one another with their horns .
The same consideration stopped me from butting the animal ; I was n't going to put my face near those teeth .
But his forehead was already swelling blue-white where Jimmy had butted him .
The rest of the females will butt him … . until his liver is pulverised . ’
Our Stella says the lad who butted him comes from a well-to-do family . "
The farmer 's tied him to the fence to stop him butting the sheep and that 's deemed to be cruel .
